intro: Brachystelma dyeri, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stonecrop, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. This succulent plant is characterized by its fleshy, narrow leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Brachystelma dyeri is a hardy plant that requires minimal water, making it well-suited for xerophytic gardens.
